author: M.A.
title: Fischi, striscioni e malumore. I dipendenti Unipol scendono in piazza
text:
/ Navile/ Via Stalingrado
Fischi, striscioni e malumore. I dipendenti Unipol scendono in piazza
Sit-in in via Stalingrado e via Larga, poi un corteo alla volta di Porta Europa. Così la mobilitazione odierna in occasione della presentazione del Piano industriale
Fischi, striscioni, malumore. Così protestano i dipendenti Unipol che come preannunciato stamane - venerdì 28 marzo - si sono radunati in presidio a Bologna in occasione della presentazione del Piano industriale del Gruppo (Milano) per "chiedere dialogo tra azienda e sindacati, riaprire un vero confronto sull'organizzazione tempi vita-lavoro, rimettere al centro le esigenze delle persone che lavorano".
Registrati alla nuova sezione Dossier BolognaToday
Dopo gli attriti degli ultimi mesi, i sindacati hanno chiamato a raccolta i dipendenti "per partecipare alla presentazione del Piano strategico 2025-2027, affinché sia chiaro che anche noi abbiamo un piano per il Gruppo Unipol", spiega la Fisac-Cgil in un comunicato.
"Un Piano che si preannuncia importante e innovativo non può continuare a basarsi su una rigida organizzazione del lavoro ottocentesca e tanto meno su relazioni industriali autoritarie, non equilibrate e inefficaci. Per affrontare il futuro è necessario recuperare dal passato, oltre che il nome della compagnia, anche Il forte legame con la propria base sociale e i valori sbandierati." si legge nel comunicato del sindacato.
Ancora sul tavolo anche la questione della cancellazione dello smart working, con la diffida partita dei sindacati First Cisl, Fisac Cgil, Uilca Uil, quando a Bologna, durante l'emergenza maltempo, non è stato autorizzato il lavoro da remoto raccomandato dai Comuni.
A Bologna giornata movimentata. Corteo Unipol e metalmeccanici
Diversi i presidi indetti per la giornata odierna per la vicenda Unipol. Due solo a Bologna - in via Stalingrado e in via Larga a Bologna (sede storica e grattacielo) - seguiti da un corteo verso gli uffici della presidenza Unipol di Porta Europa. A questi si sommano le mobilitazioni organizzate a Milano, Torino in corso Galilei e corso D'Azeglio, a Firenze in via Lorenzo il Magnifico, a Roma in piazza Esquilino, a Genova in piazza V dicembre, a Verona in via del Fante.
Non solo. Oggi si mobilitano anche i metalmeccanici, su scala nazionale. E pure nella città delle torri è stato organizzato un corteo, da Porta Saragozza alla volta della sede di Confindustria.
Iscriviti al canale Whatsapp di BolognaToday

title: Luciano Napolitano, Pappo's son, was acquitted in the gender-based violence case and ordered his release - The Limited Times
text:
The Court of Appeals of San Isidro acquitted Luciano Napolitano, son of the late rocker Pappo, who had been sentenced to 3 years and 8 months in prison for allegedly beating and threatening his ex-partner at their home in the Buenos Aires town of Benavídez. In addition, the Justice ordered his immediate release , so he will not have to continue under house arrest , a benefit to which he agreed last September.
The ruling was issued by the First Chamber of that Chamber, made up of judges Juan Eduardo Stepañiuc and Leonardo Gabriel Pitlevnik, who granted the appeal filed by the musician's defense lawyer, Roberto Casorla Yalet.
In the 15-page resolution, to which Télam had access, Judge Stepañiuc stated that "there is currently no evidence that would allow us to reach the degree of certainty necessary to categorically affirm that Napolitano is guilty of the act for which he is accused."
"The defendant has categorically denied the fact, giving a diametrically imposed version to that of the victim and in turn this version is not in contradiction with the rest of the evidence," he added.
For his part, Judge Pitlevnik considered that "the dissimilar versions " of the events "fit with both the version of Mrs. (Mariel) Oleiro and that of Mr. Napolitano, insofar as the conflict existed and that is not in question."
Luciano Napolitano was acquitted in the case of gender violence against his ex-partner.
In this way, the chamber members decided to revoke the verdict, absolve Napolitano and order the immediate release of the musician , who had already been granted house arrest, who was wearing an electronic ankle bracelet at his mother's house .
Meanwhile, judicial sources reported that the Attorney General's Office of San Isidro will appeal the recent ruling to the Buenos Aires Supreme Court.
The case against Pappo's son for gender-based violence Pappo's son had been sentenced on December 28, 2022 in the framework of an abbreviated trial, agreed with Tigre prosecutor Diego Callegari, to 3 years and 8 months in prison for two acts of gender violence against his then partner, Oleiro, 35.
Napolitano was considered the author of the crimes of "minor injuries aggravated by the bond and by mediating gender violence, threats, aggravated illegal deprivation of liberty and possession of a weapon of war" and "threats aggravated by the use of weapons", both in real competition with each other.
Ten days earlier, the judge in Correctional 4 of San Isidro, Juan Facundo Ocampo, ordered "to mitigate the measure of coercion" and to allow the " house arrest " of the musician with the monitoring of an electronic bracelet, as a result of the "state of health of the detainee" - he suffers from COPD among other ailments - and because he needed better care than what was provided in prison. in which he had been detained for more than a year and a half . He was finally granted the benefit last September.
The event that led to his conviction occurred on the afternoon of May 24, 2021 , in the home that Pappo's son had shared for four years with his partner Oleiro, located at Jujuy 3452, in the town of Benavídez , Tigre district, in the north of the conurbation.
According to the woman's complaint, it all started when she asked Napolitano for the keys to the truck to go buy food for her pets and he began to insult and physically assault her , all in front of two of the defendant's daughters, ages 7 and 13.
The complainant said that her partner grabbed her by the neck , that the aggression included punches and kicks , that he squeezed her eye , that he also doused her with alcohol, that in the courtyard of the house he tried to run her over with a Volkswagen Amarok truck and that he left her locked without being able to leave the property and with the only possibility of being in the barbecue until the next day when she managed to call 911 and was rescued by the police.
The weapon found in Luciano Napolitano's home.
Napolitano was arrested on May 26 at dawn and a search was carried out in his home in which the loaded .38 revolver was seized , which he does not have a permit to possess or carry.
Expanding on his statement, Oleiro denounced Napolitano for a previous episode, which occurred on November 21, 2020 at the home of the defendant's mother, at 1300 Juncal Street in Tigre, where the convicted man was currently serving his home stay. According to her, he smashed a picture over her head and then threatened to kill her by placing the .38 caliber revolver that was seized from her home to her head .
When questioned, Napolitano gave a version totally opposite to that of his then-girlfriend, since he said that it was an argument between a couple, that she was the one who assaulted him , that the firearm that was in his house he inherited 15 years ago from his father and that the woman knew how to leave the property. something that was discredited in the case with the testimony of the police officers who assisted the victim.
With information from Télam.

title: Tensions au Moyen-Orient : les États-Unis déploient des avions furtifs
text: Des avions furtifs F-22 Raptor ont été déployés au Moyen-Orient. AFP/Karim Sahib Des avions de chasse furtifs F-22 Raptor sont arrivés jeudi au Moyen-Orient alors que les États-Unis renforcent leur présence militaire, craignant dans la riposte attendue de l’Iran et de ses alliés. Autre signe de préparatifs défensifs, pour la seconde fois depuis le début de la semaine, le général Michael Kurilla, chef du commandement central américain pour le Moyen-Orient (Centcom), s’est entretenu le gouvernement hébreu pour faire progresser la coopération entre les deux pays, selon The Times of Israel. Ce déploiement d’avion de combat s’inscrit dans le « changement de posture des forces américaines dans la région » et vise à « faire face aux menaces présentées par l’Iran et les groupes pro-iraniens », a annoncé le Centcom, sur le réseau social X, sans préciser la localisation exacte de ces appareils. L’armée américaine a annoncé la semaine dernière un renforcement de sa présence militaire dans la région, déployant davantage de navires de guerre et d’avions de combat, pour tenter de freiner la riposte iranienne contre Israël. En début de semaine, sept Américains ont été blessés dans une attaque à la roquette contre la base aérienne Al-Assad en Irak, imputée par Washington à un groupe pro-iranien. Cette attaque est intervenue quelques jours après la mort dans une frappe américaine de quatre combattants irakiens favorables au régime de Téhéran. De telles attaques étaient fréquentes au début de la guerre entre Israël et le Hamas palestinien dans la bande de Gaza, mais depuis elles ont beaucoup diminué. Téhéran accuse Israël de vouloir « étendre la guerre » Téhéran est ses alliés régionaux au Liban, en Irak et au Yémen menacent Israël de représailles armées depuis l’assassinat le 31 juillet dans la capitale iranienne du chef du Hamas Ismaïl Haniyeh, qu’ils ont imputé à Israël, et celui, la veille, de Fouad Chokr, le chef militaire du Hezbollah libanais pro-iranien tué dans une frappe israélienne près de Beyrouth. Ce jeudi encore, le ministre iranien des Affaires étrangères par intérim, a jugé que l’assassinat d’Ismaïl Haniyeh, « acte que les sionistes ont commis à Téhéran est une erreur stratégique et leur coûtera cher », dans un entretien donné à l’AFP, depuis la ville de Jeddah en Arabie saoudite. Au passage, le ministre a accusé l’État hébreu de vouloir « étendre la guerre » dans la région, tout en jugeant qu’il n’a « ni la capacité ni la force » pour combattre l’Iran. Le Hamas a remplacé par le chef du Hamas à Gaza, Yahya Sinouar. Ce dernier est accusé par Israël d’être un cerveau de l’attaque lancée le 7 octobre par le mouvement islamiste sur le sol israélien.

author: Por NOAH TRISTER
title: Un año después de que se presentó una crisis para los running backs, esta semana fue para celebrar
text:
Un año después de que se presentó una crisis para los running backs, esta semana fue para celebrar
Un año después de que su posición estuvo en crisis, Derrick Henry aún siente un vínculo con sus compañeros running backs.
Esta fue una semana para disfrutar.
“Definitivamente feliz de verlos salir del mercado tan rápido. Creo que eso dice mucho sobre que aún es muy necesaria la posición de corredor, aunque no lo parezca”, aseguró el jueves Henry, uno de varios agentes libres que encontraron un nuevo equipo en los últimos días. “Aún necesitan correr el balón. Aún necesitas a ese jugador que puede cambiar el partido en cualquier circunstancia”.
Ser corredor sigue sin ser tan lucrativo como otras posiciones, pero este año algunos de los mejores running backs disfrutaron algo que no tiene precio —la libertad de moverse.
Henry dejó a unos Titans que fueron últimos para unirse a Baltimore, que tiene mejor ataque por tierra. Saquon Barkley pasó de los Gigantes a una posible ofensiva dinámica con los Eagles. Tony Pollard se unió a los Titans en reemplazo de Henry y Josh Jacobs pasó de Las Vegas a Green Bay, un equipo de postemporada.
Barkley, Pollard y Jacobs recibieron la etiqueta de jugador franquicia la campaña anterior para posponer su oportunidad de probar la agencia libre.
Ninguno de los tres pudo asegurar contratos a largo plazo el año pasado, menoscabando la importancia de la posición. Los corredores no son vistos como una inversión fuera del contrato de novato y la etiqueta de jugador franquicia tiene el menor valor de cualquier posición fuera del pateador y punter.
Henry abrió un grupo de chat entre los mejores jugadores de la posición el verano pasado.
Sin importar cuánto dinero hay disponible para running backs, la agencia libre les permite encontrar el lugar ideal, que puede ser una prioridad.
Hasta ahora, esta temporada ha sido menos molesta para los corredores que el 2023.
“Definitivamente quiero que el mercado sea justo y que seamos valorados”, admitió Henry. “Para el futuro también, para los chicos que vendrán después de nosotros”.
